result: A) The consumption of meat from wild animals that are hosts of the disease vector. Chagas disease is caused by the protozoan Trypanosoma cruzi, transmitted to humans through the bite of infected ticks and other bloodsucking insects such as barbers or sucks. The disease is more common in rural areas where people may consume meat from wild animals that are hosts of the disease vector. This can increase the risk of contracting the disease.
